coverages.details: Covers Accidental Death, Permanent Disablement and Third Degree Burns. No aggregate limit applies for family policies.

limits.type: Physiotherapist, Chinese Physician or Chiropractor (up to $50 per visit)

coverages.details: Covers outpatient and hospitalisation medical expenses incurred overseas arising from accident or sickness, emergency dental expenses arising from accident, and accidental miscarriage. Includes specified limits for treatment by Physiotherapist, Chinese Physician, Chiropractor, and Dentist.

coverages.coverage_name: Medical Expenses Incurred Upon Return to Singapore

limits.type: Physiotherapist, Chinese Physician or Chiropractor (up to $50 per visit)

coverages.details: Covers follow-up treatment within 31 days from return date. If initial treatment was not sought overseas, treatment in Singapore must be sought within 48 hours from return date and is covered for up to 31 days. Includes specified limits for treatment by Physiotherapist, Chinese Physician, Chiropractor, and Dentist.

coverages.coverage_name: Emergency Medical Evacuation & Repatriation (Including Mortal Remains) Back to Singapore

limits.type: Per Insured Person up to 70 years
Per Insured Person up to 70 years (Pre-existing Conditions)
Per Insured Person above 70 years (Pre-existing Conditions)

coverages.details: Covers necessary expenses for emergency evacuation and repatriation back to Singapore, including mortal remains. Includes coverage for pregnancy-related complications and pre-existing medical conditions, subject to the specified limits. No aggregate limit applies for family policies.
Pays a cash allowance for each complete day (24 hours) of hospitalisation while overseas, up to a maximum of 200 days.

coverages.coverage_name: Double Hospitalisation Allowance Whilst Overseas in ICU Arising from an Accident
coverages.details: Pays double the Overseas Hospitalisation Allowance for each complete day (24 hours) confined in an Intensive Care Unit (ICU) overseas due to an accident, up to a maximum of 10 days. This benefit is payable instead of the standard Overseas Hospitalisation Allowance (Section 5).

coverages.coverage_name: Hospital Allowance for Hospitalisation in Singapore
coverages.details: Pays a cash allowance for each complete day (24 hours) of hospitalisation in Singapore upon return, for continued treatment of an injury or illness first sustained overseas. Different rates apply for the first 3 days and the subsequent 7 days.
Covers reasonable additional accommodation and travelling expenses incurred on written advice from a qualified medical practitioner as a result of the Insured Person's accident or sickness overseas.

coverages.coverage_name: Guardian for Return of Dependent Children
coverages.details: Covers reasonable travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to travel from Singapore to accompany the Insured's dependent child(ren) back home, if the Insured is hospitalised overseas.

coverages.coverage_name: Compassionate Visit by a Relative or Friend

limits.type: Per Insured Person (In the event of death)
Per Family (In the event of death)

coverages.details: Covers reasonable travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to travel to the Insured Person if the Insured Person is hospitalised for more than 5 consecutive days due to injury, sickness or disease, or in the event of the Insured Person's death overseas.

Coverage under Personal Accident and Medical Expenses sections extends to specified amateur sports including tandem air sports (skydiving, hang-gliding, paragliding), snow-skiing, hot-air ballooning, bungee jumping, indoor rock climbing and trekking up to 3,500m above sea level for all mountains. Limits are as per the respective Personal Accident/Medical sections.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or Damage to Baggage & Personal Effects
coverages.details: Covers accidental loss or damage to baggage, clothing, and personal effects during the trip. Subject to various sub-limits per item, category, and overall maximums as specified.

limits.type: Fraudulent use of credit card overseas

coverages.details: Covers costs of replacing lost/stolen travel documents (passport, tickets). Also covers loss of cash or traveller's cheques due to theft (up to $400) and fraudulent use of credit cards (up to $1000). Requires police report within 24 hours.

Covers loss of irrecoverable deposits or travel expenses paid in advance due to necessary cancellation, postponement, or replacement of traveller arising from Insured Events (e.g., death, serious injury/sickness, witness call, strike, natural disaster) occurring within 30 days before departure. Includes loss of frequent flyer points.

Covers loss of irrecoverable prepaid travel costs and additional travel expenses incurred for necessary return to Singapore due to Insured Events (e.g., death, serious injury/sickness, strike, natural disaster, recall by authorities) occurring after trip departure.

Covers loss of un-utilised portion of prepaid travel costs and additional expenses incurred whilst overseas due to disruption caused by Insured Events. Also covers up to $100 for unused event tickets resulting from such disruption.

coverages.coverage_name: Financial Collapse of Licensed Tour Operators
coverages.details: Covers loss of non-refundable or un-utilised prepaid travel costs and expenses due to trip cancellation or curtailment resulting from the financial collapse of a licensed tour operator, travel agent, or transport provider, occurring after the policy issue date.
Covers legal liability incurred in a personal capacity for accidental bodily injury to third parties or accidental loss/damage to third party property occurring during the trip.

limits.type: Per Insured Person (1st full 6 hrs delay overseas)
Per Insured Person (1st full 6 hrs delay Singapore)
Per Insured Person (Subsequent full 4 hrs delay overseas)

coverages.details: Pays a cash benefit if checked-in baggage is delayed for at least 6 full consecutive hours upon arrival. Different rates apply for the initial 6-hour delay (overseas vs Singapore arrival) and subsequent full 4-hour blocks (overseas only). Includes delay due to wrongful pick-up by another passenger overseas. Requires written confirmation from carrier.

limits.type: Per Insured Person (1st full 6 hrs delay overseas/S'pore)
Per Insured Person (Subsequent full 4 hrs delay overseas)

coverages.details: Pays a cash benefit for delay of the scheduled public conveyance for at least 6 full consecutive hours from the scheduled time, due to any cause beyond your control. Payout based on actual arrival time vs original schedule. Subsequent payments for every full 4 consecutive hours of delay thereafter (overseas only). Requires written confirmation from carrier.

Pays a one-off cash benefit if you are denied boarding on a confirmed scheduled flight whilst overseas due to overbooking, and no alternative transportation is provided within 6 hours of the scheduled departure time.

limits.type: Per Insured Person (1st full 6 hrs delay)
Per Insured Person (Subsequent full 4 hrs delay)

coverages.details: Pays a cash benefit if your flight is diverted from its scheduled route resulting in delay upon arrival at destination. Payable for the first full 6 consecutive hours of delay, and subsequent full 4 consecutive hours thereafter. Applies if diversion is due to (a) adverse weather or (b) landing at alternative destination for emergency medical treatment of a fellow passenger. Requires written confirmation from carrier.
Pays a cash benefit for every full 12 consecutive hours of delay resulting from the hijacking of the public conveyance in which the Insured Person is travelling.

Pays a cash benefit for every full 24 consecutive hours that pre-booked and paid hotel facilities (like swimming pool, sauna, gym) are unavailable due to breakdown of equipment or staff strike, provided no alternative facilities are offered by the hotel management.

Pays a one-off cash benefit if you fail to connect to a confirmed onward scheduled public conveyance due to the late arrival of your incoming connecting conveyance, and no alternative is made available within 6 hours of the scheduled departure time of the onward conveyance.
Pays a cash benefit for every full 48 consecutive hours the Insured Person is unlawfully detained (kidnapped) during the trip.

limits.type: Per Insured Person (In aggregate for applicable Sections)

coverages.details: Provides cover up to the aggregate limit for losses arising directly from an Act of Terrorism across relevant policy sections (e.g., Personal Accident, Medical Expenses, etc.). This limit represents the maximum total payout across multiple covered sections for claims resulting from a single terrorism event.

Extends the Personal Accident cover (Section 1) to include Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement if sustained as an innocent bystander due to war between nations or civil war. The limits applicable are those stated under Section 1 (Personal Accident).

limits.type: Per Insured Person (In aggregate for applicable Sections)

coverages.details: Provides cover up to the aggregate limit for claims arising from participation in leisure underwater activities (like scuba diving under qualified supervision, subject to policy terms) across relevant policy sections. This limit represents the maximum total payout across multiple covered sections for claims related to such activities.

Covers reasonable additional costs for necessary alternative accommodation if pre-booked accommodation becomes uninhabitable and is cancelled after the trip has commenced due to fire, flood, earthquake, or other specified natural disasters.

Covers reasonable additional costs for necessary alternative travel arrangements to reach the scheduled destination if the booked public conveyance is cancelled or delayed for more than 24 hours after the trip has commenced due to specified events like strike, riot, natural disaster, or mechanical breakdown.
Reimburses administrative or phone call charges incurred by the Insured Person for the purpose of seeking emergency assistance or notifying claims due to an event covered under the policy.

Reimburses the policy excess amount that the Insured Person becomes legally liable to pay under the rental vehicle agreement due to accidental loss of or damage to the rented private vehicle during the trip.
Covers reasonable and necessary expenses for skin transplantation and/or reconstructive surgery required as a direct result of accidental burns sustained during the trip.

coverages.coverage_name: Recuperation Allowance Due to Accidental Miscarriage
coverages.details: Pays a one-off cash allowance if the Insured Person suffers an accidental miscarriage during the trip. Does not cover miscarriage arising from sickness.

coverages.coverage_name: Quarantine Allowance Due to 17 Infectious Diseases Upon Return to Singapore
coverages.details: Pays a daily cash allowance if the Insured Person is ordered into quarantine by relevant authorities upon return to Singapore due to being diagnosed with one of the 17 specified infectious diseases (including SARS, Dengue, MERS, Zika, listed strains of Avian Flu etc.) contracted during the trip. Maximum 5 days payable.

limits.type: Loss or damage of golf equipment

coverages.details: Provides cover for accidental loss/damage to owned/rented golf equipment, reimbursement of celebratory costs for achieving a hole-in-one during a competition, reimbursement of irrecoverable unused green fees due to injury/sickness, and legal liability for accidental damage to a third-party golf buggy. All limits Per Insured Person.

coverages.coverage_name: Free and Automatic Extension of Policy
coverages.details: The policy period will be automatically extended without additional premium for up to 14 days if the Insured Person's return to Singapore is unavoidably delayed beyond the policy expiry date due to their serious injury/illness/quarantine, or the delay/cancellation of public conveyance beyond their control.
